content.description:
Problem A in red on the map of the boulder.

 Start standing with both hands on top of the ledge. Your hands need to be only on the smooth, gritty, featureless sloper part of the ledge and not spread apart on the further corners of the boulders lip. Use any feet and top out on the ledge.
content.location: This problem is problem A in red on the map of the boulder. Walking up to the Warm up boulder, walk left around the front and then around the left side of the boulder. look for the large in-cut on the boulder right past the corner, and notice the ledge above it. this is the mantle.

content.description:
This problem is problem B in green on the map of the boulder.

 Sit start with you left hand on a small pocket side pull. Stand up to the in-cut with you right hand going to a small crimp rail. Move up to the sloper ledge and top out like the standing version.
content.location: This problem is problem B in green on the map of the boulder. Same as "Warm Up Mantle standing", only sit start with one hand in a small finger pocket side pull at the bottom.

content.description:
(Not listed on the topo)

 Stand start at the far right side of the boulder. (just left of "Between The Trees") Start in the flat jugs at the long horizontal seam that along runs the front face of the boulder.

 Traverse left and follow the seam until you reach the Large sloper used in "Dial Zero". Finish as per "dial Zero".

Using the same sit start as "Dial Zero Right", throw up and right to a ledge, (for a more challenging eliminate toss further up and right to the mono). Move to a far, slopey flat section of the top of the boulder. kick a right foot out to the mono below, and press. Negotiate to the sloper and mantle.
content.location:
This problem is problem E in red on the map of the boulder.

 To the right of "Dial Zero Right" using the same sit start, and trending right.

content.description:
(Not listed on the topo)

 Stand start matched on the crimp rail to the left of "Dial Zero." get your feet on anything below and make a move up to the rail above, used on "Dial Zero." Match the rail and toss to the top. top out. (This problem trends left to the right.)
content.location: just to the left of "Dial Zero" and using the crimp rail of dial zero as well....   Stand start on the crimp rail to the left.

content.description: Sit Start low on a deep and narrow in-cut ledge to the right of "Dial Zero."   Toss up to a small finger ledge with you left, and follow up with your right hand.    bump hands out left to a slopey ledge and then to the top of the boulder. Top out to the right of the "Dial Zero" top out. (No Monos)
content.location:
This problem is problem D in purple on the map of the boulder.

 Just to the right of "Dial Zero" and from the sit start.

content.description:
This is simply a sit start to the standard Dial Zero line. 

  Sit start low on holds that are worse than the rest of the problem and make a hard move into the stand start proper. Finish standard Zero.

Stand start with hands in the middle of the boulder, left hand in a left facing lip, right on a slopy ledge.   bump the right hand up to a bigger slopy ledge, and throw your left hand out to a far crimp rail.   Dead point the top and search for any of the three mono pockets that are up there and use them to help you top out.
content.location: This problem is problem C in blue on the map of the boulder. Walk up from the road to the warm up boulder. Dial Zero will be on the far left side of the front of the boulder.

content.description: sit start on the bottom sloper with a right foot on a edge out right.   Off the start, toss to a small pockety lip. Hand foot match the sloper below.   toss to a slopy shelf for a tricky mantle.
content.location:
This problem is problem E in green on the map of the boulder.

 To the far right of the front of the boulder. look the right of the giant loose sounding flake, and in front of the tree. sit start down on the bottom sloper.

content.description: The first Boulder you come to on the right side of the road. fall through spring it is visible from the road, (also in the summer if you know when to look). It is long and not more than 9 feet tall in most places. for the most part, the top out will be the crux. this boulder offers a great way to warm up, and also a quick way to get a climb in for locals
